sentences.en: For among Julia's friends there was a kind of gerontophilic snobbery.
sentences.cn: 因为在朱莉娅的朋友中有一些过分敬老的势利之徒.

sentences.en: Hardly less characteristic of our age is that repulsive booze - snobbery.
sentences.cn: 几乎与此同样反映了我们这个时代特征的是对狂饮的势利感.

sentences.en: He is spoiled, arrogant and has a tendency towards snobbery.
sentences.cn: 他被宠坏了，傲慢无礼，而且经常自命不凡。

sentences.en: Her artificial world was redolent of orchids and pleasant , cheerful snobbery.
sentences.cn: 她那人为的世界充满了兰花, 愉快的势力风尚.

sentences.en: Her novel is a satire on social snobbery.
sentences.cn: 她的小说是描写势利小人的讽刺作品.

sentences.en: If snobbery, selfishness and disease are the result of growing - up.
sentences.cn: 如果长大的结果就是势利 、 自私和疾病.

sentences.en: Isabelle is quick to refute any suggestion of intellectual snobbery.
sentences.cn: 伊莎贝尔对于任何关于她恃才傲物的暗示都迅速予以否认。

sentences.en: It isn't snobbery; it's just a matter of hospital discipline and common sense.
sentences.cn: 这并不是势利, 它只是医院的常规,也是普通的常识.
乔斯琳指责德克斯特势力.

sentences.en: Like the protesters of subsequent generations, they laid themselves open to the charge of snobbery.
sentences.cn: 和以后各代的反对者一样, 他们被人们骂为摆绅士架子.

sentences.en: Snobbery is not limited to'racial profiling'among witches and wizards either.
sentences.cn: 巫师之间的势力侵犯不只局限于 “ 种族问题 ”.

sentences.en: There was very little snobbery or class-consciousness in the wartime navy.
sentences.cn: 战时的海军中很少有势利眼，阶级意识也不强。

sentences.en: There were music festival and modern dancing, riding to hounds or other kinds of snobbery.
sentences.cn: 那种地方有音乐节和现代舞, 有骑马打猎和其他自以为高级的玩意儿.

sentences.en: They considered her behaviour a shameful piece of snobbery.
sentences.cn: 他们认为她为人势利,行为可耻.

sentences.en: Though he patrician self - confidence , there was no snobbery in Roosevelt.
sentences.cn: 罗斯福有着出身贵族的 自信 满满, 但却毫无趋炎附势的丑恶嘴脸.

words.tran_cn: 势利小人，势利眼；假内行
势利,卑躬,傲慢,藐视,自负,虚荣,自大,自夸,利己主义

trans.tran_cn: 势利，谄上欺下，摆绅士架子，势利的行为或语言
trans.tran_en: behaviour or attitudes which show that you think you are better than other people, because you belong to a higher social class or know much more than they do – used to show disapproval
